content.question: The United States Supreme Courtâ€™s decision in Dred Scott v. Sandford (1857) represented a departure from earlier practices in which of the following ways?

choices.label: It established the principle of judicial review, the practice in which the Supreme Court has the authority to evaluate whether laws are consistent with the Constitution.
It introduced the idea of popular sovereignty, the arrangement in which residents of a federal territory could vote whether that territory would allow slavery.
It expanded fugitive slave laws that permitted slaveholders to recover formerly enslaved people even if they had escaped to free states.
It held that the federal government had no power to regulate slavery in federal territories acquired after the creation of the United States.

content.answer: It held that the federal government had no power to regulate slavery in federal territories acquired after the creation of the United States.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
